snippet: The legislation would have allowed students without proper immigration status to receive financial aid through state programs, if they met certain conditions.
abstract: New York State Senate rejects legislation that would have granted state tuition aid to undocumented immigrants, dealing a blow to immigrant advocates who have been leaning on the Senate for months; Republicans, however, showed no interest in considering the legislation, and the decision to hold a vote came abruptly, with almost no notice.

byline.original: By THOMAS KAPLAN and JESSE McKINLEY

lead_paragraph: The legislation would have allowed students without proper immigration status to receive financial aid through state programs, if they met certain conditions.

headline.main: State Senate Rejects Bill Granting Tuition Aid to Illegal Immigrants
headline.print_headline: State Senate Rejects Bill Granting Tuition Aid to Illegal Immigrants

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Dream Act (Development, Relief and Education for Minors Act)
